qas.question: The Governor of Bermuda gets his authority from whom?
Who appoints the Governor of Bermuda?

answers.text: the Queen on the advice of the British Government.

qas.question: Who is currently the governor of Bermuda?
Who is responsible for defence and foreign affairs?
What is Bermuda officially classified as?
Who exercises executive authority on behalf of the Governor?
Who is the Queen appointed by?
What title does George Arkely currently hold?
What title does David Fergusson currently hold?

plausible_answers.text: a Royal Assent granted Bermuda limited self-governance

context: Executive authority in Bermuda is vested in <a0_0><b5_0>the monarch<b5_0/><a0_0/> and is exercised on her behalf by the Governor. <b6_0>The governor<b6_0/> is appointed by <a1_0>the Queen on the advice of the British Government.<a1_0/> The current <b7_0>governor<b7_0/> is <a2_0>George Fergusson<a2_0/>; he was sworn in on 23 May 2012. There is also a <b8_0>Deputy Governor<b8_0/> (currently David Arkley JP). Defence and foreign affairs are carried out by the <a3_0>United Kingdom<a3_0/>, which also retains responsibility to ensure good government. It must approve any changes to the Constitution of Bermuda. Bermuda is classified as a <a4_0>British Overseas Territory<a4_0/>, but it is the oldest British colony. In 1620, <b9_0>a Royal Assent granted Bermuda limited self-governance<b9_0/>; its Parliament is the fifth oldest in the world, behind the Parliament of the United Kingdom, the Tynwald of the Isle of Man, the Althing of Iceland, and Sejm of Poland. Of these, only Bermuda's and the Isle of Man's Tynwald have been in continuous existence since 1620.
